title: Business Live: Wall Street falls - BBC News
summary: lego cuts 1,400 jobs as sales slide .
car sales fall for fifth consecutive month .
sterling up against euro and dollar .

documents.title: good night , sleep tight
text: that 's all from the business live page for tonight .
join us again tomorrow from 06:00 .

documents.title: financials drag down wall street
text: wall street stocks slid on tuesday , with financial shares falling hard , as renewed worries about north korea pushed investors away from equities and towards bonds and other safer investments .
the dow jones fell 1.1 % to close the first session after the holiday weekend at 21,753.31 .
the broad-based s & p 500 shed 0.8 % to end at 2,457.85 , while the tech-rich nasdaq dropped 0.9 % to 6,375.57 .
large banks were hammered as investors fled into us treasury bonds , a low-risk asset .
bank of america lost 3.3 % , goldman sachs 3.6 % and jpmorgan chase 2.4 % .
but home-improvement retailers lowe 's and home depot both climbed more than 1 % as another major hurricane , irma , approached the us .
the chains ty see a jump in sales as a result of storms .
aircraft parts supplier rockwell collins rose 0.3 % following the announcement it agreed to be bought by conglomerate united technologies for $ 30bn .
but dow member united technologies fell 5.7 % , with declines accelerating after boeing , a customer of both companies , suggested it could try to prod regulators to block the deal .
boeing fell 1.4 % .
toy companies hasbro and mattel lost 2.9 % and 1.6 % , respectively , after danish toy giant lego announced it would slash 8 % of its global workforce after a drop in sales in the us and europe .

documents.title: company says it has made a new type of chocolate
text: here 's a new type of chocolate in town and it 's called ruby , because of it 's reddish-pink colour .
barry callebaut , a company which makes chocolate and cocoa products , says it is not just a new flavour of chocolate but a whole new type .
the flavour and colour comes from the bean that it 's made from : the ruby cocoa bean .
read more here .

documents.title: buy-to-let lender floats
text: who said buy-to-let was dead ?
charter court financial services , a wolverhampton-based buy-to-let lender , plans to float on the london stock exchange in a move that will raise £ 20m .
majority owners elliott international and elliott associates will contribute to the global offer by selling down their current stake , while old mutual has subscribed for £ 100m of existing shares .
about 40 % of the business will be put on the market as free floating shares .
the rest of which will continue to be held by elliott and charter court management .
the challenger bank is understood to be aiming for a £ 500m valuation .

documents.title: trump daca move 'self-defeating ' and 'cruel '

documents.title: asda 'forced to reimburse suppliers '
text: asda had to pay back dozens of suppliers hundreds of thousands of pounds after breaching fair dealing rules , the guardian reports .
the supermarket giant had demanded up-front payments to the value of up to quarter of annual sales of some products for firms to retain their supply contracts , the guardian says .

documents.title: trump daca decision 'will be a significant blow to business '
text: donald trump 's decision to repeal the deferred action for childhood arrivals ( daca ) could lead to the deportation of about 800,000 young people , known as `` dreamers '' , from the us .
this would reduce the labour force by about 0.5 % in five years , moody 's chief economist mark zandi tells yahoo finance .
that translates to a loss of $ 105bn over the same period , as a conservative estimate , the article says .

the dreamers are on track to be a highly educated group and losing them will be a significant blow to businesses already struggling to find educated and skilled young workers , '' mr zandi is quoted as saying .

documents.title: us virgin islands seaports closed ahead of irma
text: the us virgin islands seaports have been closed to commercial traffic by the us coast guard until further notice ahead of hurricane irma , the port authority said .

documents.title: travel disruption as hurricane irma forces flight cancellations

documents.title: leaked home office document reveals brexit immigration plans
text: the home office plans to end the free movement of labour immediately after brexit and introduce measures to restrict low-skilled labour , according to a document leaked to the guardian .

the document has `` provoked rows between cabinet ministers , who are trying to balance the demands of british businesses wanting to retain free movement , and the views of hardline brexiters , '' the guardian article says .

documents.title: wall street lower as north korea tensions weigh
text: us stocks are lower , with the dow jones industrial average shedding more than 250 points as tensions around north korea continued to weigh .

north korea on sunday conducted its sixth nuclear test , which it said was of an advanced hydrogen bomb for a long-range missile , marking a dramatic escalation of the regime 's stand-off with the us and its allies .

`` it looks as though escalation has gone to the next level , but there are lot of things in the coming weeks that may be causing people to get a little bit more cautious , '' said randy frederick , vice president of trading and derivatives for charles schwab in austin , texas .

documents.title: florida insurers shares fall as hurricane irma looms
text: shares in florida home insurers such as heritage insurance holdings are tumbling as investors brace for losses from hurricane irma .
the storm is forecast to hit the state on saturday .
shares in universal insurance holdings are down nearly 18 % , and heritage shares are down more than 13 % .

documents.title: virgin atlantic shifts antigua flight forward
text: virgin atlantic has shifted its flight from antigua on tuesday forward by five hours , now departing at 2.20pm local time , as hurricane irma barrels across the atlantic .
a spokeswoman said :
`` we are monitoring the expected adverse weather conditions caused by hurricane irma over antigua and currently all flights will operate as scheduled .
`` however , we do ask all customers to check the status of their flights at before they travel to the airport as we may need to make some changes or cancellations . ''

the safety and comfort of our customers is our top priority and any customers booked to travel to , from or through antigua between today and 11september may rebook their flights to an alternative date or alternative caribbean destination travelling on or before 12 october . ''

documents.title: ba braces for hurricane irma
text: hurricane irma , which has been threatening the caribbean , has been upgraded to a category five - the highest category - making it `` extremely dangerous '' .
british airways says :
`` the safety of our customers and crew is always our priority .
`` we are in contact with travellers in antigua and have laid on a special flight today to get as many home as possible before the hurricane arrives on the island .
`` the antigua and st kitts airport authorities have advised us that their airports will be closed tomorrow .
`` we have offered all customers due to travel to the region in the coming days a range of re-booking options and are keeping our flights to the entire region under review.​ ''

documents.title: trump scraps 'dreamer ' immigration programme
text: president donald trump has scrapped a programme that protects from deportation almost 800,000 young men and women who were brought into the us illegally as children , giving a gridlocked congress six months to decide their fate .
mr trump 's action , announced by attorney general jeff sessions , rescinds a program called deferred action for childhood arrivals ( daca ) .
the end of the programme has been put back , passing responsibility for the fate of the `` dreamers '' , as they are known , to mr trump 's fellow republicans who control congress .
however , congress has been unable since the president took office in january to pass any major legislation , and has been bitterly divided over immigration in the past .
the shows a group of people in the daca programme who would like to serve in us armed forces but ca n't due to their immigration status .

documents.title: ftse closes down after uk service sector growth slows
text: britain 's top share index has closed lower after a survey indicated a slowdown in growth in the dominant uk services sector and the political fallout from north korea 's latest nuclear test at the weekend continued .
the ftse 100 closed down 0.52 % at 7,372.92 points .
the ihs markit/cips purchasing managers ' index ( pmi ) for august dropped to 53.2 from 53.8 in july , its slowest pace in nearly a year .
a figure above 50 indicates expansion .

documents.title: us congress committees urge keeping south korea trade deal
text: senior us republicans and democrats on two congressional committees overseeing trade policy have said that while improvements were needed in south korea 's compliance with a us-korean free trade deal , the us `` must not withdraw from the agreement . ''

the chairmen and senior democrats on the house of representatives ways and means committee and the senate finance committee noted that north korea 's latest nuclear weapons test `` underscores the vital importance of the strong alliance between the us and south korea . ''
they made the statement after president donald trump on saturday said he was weighing the fate of the five-year-old trade deal .

documents.title: merkel and abe agree north korea sanctions should be stepped up
text: german chancellor angela merkel and japanese prime minister shinzo abe agreed in a phone conversation that sanctions against pyongyang should be stepped up in response to north korea 's latest nuclear test , a spokesman for the german government has said .

`` she agreed with prime minister abe that [ the ] test threatened the security of the entire world and that this massive violation of the un security council 's resolution must result in a resolute reaction from the international community as well as tougher sanctions , '' spokesman steffen seibert said .

mrs merkel and mr abe agreed that increased pressure on north korea should make pyongyang more willing to agree to a peaceful solution and that china and russia had a key role to play in that , mr seibert added .
wall street opened lower as investors remained cautious after north korea conducted its most powerful nuclear test over the weekend .

documents.title: uzbekistan lifts soviet-era currency trade restrictions
text: uzbeks can legally buy and sell foreign currency for the first time in decades today , after president shavkat mirziyoyev lifted most restrictions as part of big economic reforms .
the moves are intended to make the country more attractive to foreign investors .

on monday , the central bank devalued the official exchange rate of the som currency to 8,100 sums per dollar from 4,210 per dollar , making legal exchange bureaus more attractive than the black market , where the rate has been around 7,700 .

documents.title: scotland to create new national investment bank
text: scotland is to create a national investment bank to boost infrastructure investment , first minister nicola sturgeon told scotland 's parliament .
`` we believe that the time is now right to take a new approach on capital investment , '' she said .

documents.title: scotland aims for no new diesel cars after 2032
text: scotland aims to trump rest of uk on phasing out petrol & diesel cars - sturgeon says no new cars after 2032 as opposed to 2040
ca n't stick to own manifesto claims within a few months of making them , but happy to promise things 15 years in the future .

what a job to have .

documents.title: uk economy loses momentum as brexit worries mount
text: the uk economy seems to be falling further behind the eurozone as firms worry about brexit and consumers feel the pinch of rising inflation and the weak pound , surveys suggested .

manufacturers are benefiting from increasing demand in europe and beyond , but the much bigger uk services sector grew at its weakest pace in nearly a year in august , according to the ihs markit/cips services purchasing managers ' index .
read more here .

documents.title: bell pottinger investor writes off stake
text: the second-biggest shareholder in bell pottinger is writing off its stake in the troubled public relations company .
advertising firm chime has abandoned its attempt to sell a 27 % stake in bell pottinger after it was expelled from the pr industry trade body .
chime executives include lord coe and advertising giant wpp is one of its main shareholders .
the future of bell pottinger is in question after a scandal involving a campaign in south africa .

documents.title: the perils of being a digital nomad
text: the problem # expats find when travelling abroad , then returning home
@ twitterid american spelling on the bbc - 'it took her months to get driver 's license . '
if you ca n't spell use `` spell checker '' @ twitterid

documents.title: bank of scotland attracts most complaints
text: the bank of scotland remains the most complained about financial business in the uk , according to the complaints watchdog .
in the first six months of 2017 , the financial ombudsman said it dealt with 20,541 complaints about the firm - part of the lloyds banking group .
however , only 22 % of those complaints were upheld .
the vast majority of the complaints about the bank of scotland - 83 % - concerned its sales of ppi insurance .

documents.title: whatsapp to introduce business charges
text: facebook is set to earn back some of the $ 22bn ( £ 17bn ) it spent to buy whatsapp three years ago , via the messaging service 's new business tools , according to the wall street journal .
the tools , which have been tested this summer , are free but whatsapp will eventually charge companies to use some features which are going to be introduced
the tools help businesses of all sizes talk to customers over the app and are adopting a different approach to money-making from other facebook products , which rely on advertising .
we want to put a basic foundation in place to allow people to message businesses and for them to get the responses that they want , '' said whatsapp 's chief operating officer , matt idema .

documents.title: on track
text: london 's highest running track has been unveiled at the white collar factory in old street , east london .
the flexible workplace development covers six buildings and features incubator workplaces and studios as well as restaurants and apartments .
it also features a 150m-long rooftop running track and a roof terrace .
according to city am , the building has been 87 % let , with tenants including adobe and - appropriately enough - fintech firm runpath .

documents.title: vote of confidence - or a bargain buy ?
text: french company buys uk company .
vote of confidence in post brexit uk , or pilfering crown jewels at a knockdown price thanks to fall in sterling after the referendum ?
this was the question asked when japan 's softbank bought britain 's biggest tech company , arm holdings , in the immediate aftermath of the brexit vote .
the two transactions are very different .
first , softbank committed to doubling arm 's uk based workforce over five years - there is no such commitment here .
in fact , there were immediate warnings from aveva and schneider that job cuts may be needed to produce savings .
second , schneider and aveva have tried to tie the knot twice before .
both of those occasions were pre-referendum , so it 's hard to argue this is an opportunistic raid on a company that happens to be cheap thanks to the weak pound .
however , there are similarities .
both businesses are based in cambridge and are indeed jewels in the uk 's technology crown .
both make more than half their money in foreign currencies and are less exposed to the uk economy 's uncertain prospects .
both companies are knowledge-based and do not send many tangible goods across the uk-eu border .
there was a fear that the fall in sterling would create a stampede of foreign buyers for uk businesses .
it never materialised - thanks , according to merger experts i speak to , to the ongoing uncertainty over the uk 's post-brexit trading relationships .
nevertheless , uk companies that fit the above `` goldilocks '' profile look cheaper than a year ago - particularly to european buyers .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: the woman who earns a living from online gaming
text: thinking about a career change ?
twenty-four-year-old @ twitterid from hampshire says she earns more than the average household income from playing games online and charging people to watch her .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: sports direct 'broke promise ' to axe zero hours contracts
text: sports direct 'broke promise ' to axe zero-hours contracts
i 'm shocked tbh , he looks so trustworthy
zero-hours job working for the government .

documents.title: rock n roll
text: hard to believe almost but next wednesday is 10 years to the day that northern rock collapsed , heralding the start of the financial crisis .

if you want to relive those heady days of 2007 and have nothing much on next wednesday morning , why not pop down to the resolution foundation and hear alistair darling , then chancellor , reflecting on those events .
nicky morgan , chair of the treasury select committee , will consider whether we are now better placed for future financial shocks .

documents.title: nigeria exits recession
text: more good news from africa .
nigeria has exited its worst economic recession in over two decades after its economy grew by 0.6 % in the second quarter .
the country has been battered by low global oil prices since mid-2014 , which slashed government revenues and weakened the currency .
its gdp contracted for five straight quarters .
according to official data , the recovery was driven by improved performance from the oil , agriculture , manufacturing and trade sectors .

documents.title: bank welcomes unite settlement
text: the bank of england has welcomed its settlement with unite workers :
the proposal that has been agreed includes a range of measures focused on improving our relationship with unite and involving them more in pay discussions .
we hope this leads to a more productive relationship with the union going forward .

documents.title: unite strikes bank of england pay deal
text: the unite union has reached a pay deal with the bank of england , ending a dispute that led to threadneedle street 's first strike in more than 50 years .
last month some maintenance and security staff stopped work for three days .
there were protests outside the bank too (
`` unite is pleased to bring the bank of england dispute to an end having secured significant improvements for staff across the organisation , '' said mercedes sanchez of unite .

documents.title: being brave
text: business producer kim gittleson tweets about the new marketplace programme being produced by the bbc for npr radio in the us :
do one thing that scares you like launch a new global business program with @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
we rocked it today !
congratulations !
congratulations @ twitterid on launching your new global business program !
look at that lovely interface on ancient windows 7 .
well done @ twitterid it seems you like cyber attacks .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: south africa out of recession
text: south africa 's economy has pulled itself out of recession , after expanding by 2.5 % in the second quarter of the year .
the recovery was largely thanks to strong growth in agriculture .
however , economists say that while the figures show the economy has stopped contracting , it will continue to struggle in the short-term .
back in july , south africa 's central bank halved its growth forecast for the full year to just 0.5 % and unemployment remains stubbornly high at nearly 28 % .
author: Matthew Davies
Editor, BBC Africa Business Report

documents.title: pound up speed
text: the pound has climbed despite the weak services sector data out earlier .
the currency is now up 0.2 % against both the dollar and the euro ( at $ 1.29650 and 1.08890 euros ) .
as a result the ftse 100 has pared its gains , slipping 0.2 % to loiter just below 7,400 .
a strong pound means that the foreign earnings of london-listed firms will be worth less when they are converted back into sterling .

documents.title: employers 'ca n't monitor ' private messages
text: employers 'ca n't monitor ' private messages
your story literally says the opposite , that they can continue to monitor as long as notice is given .
actually they can , depending on the circumstances .

documents.title: games workshop profits recovering
text: tabletop wargame maker games workshop has revealed that its profits and revenues are well above the same period in the prior year '' .
games workshop shares jumped by over 10 % this morning after the nottingham-based firm announced a dividend of 35p per share .
in the last 12 months , shares have risen by 154 % , according to the telegraph .
the results show the miniature figurine manufacturer has continued its recovery since 2015 , when profits fell due to disappointing christmas sales and a slowdown on the high street .

documents.title: tencent takes to the skies
text: chinese internet giant tencent is backing lilium , a german flying taxi startup .

lilium has raised $ 100m ( £ 77.4m ) in capital from investors including twitter co-founder ev williams ' obvious ventures , luxembourg private bank lgt group and uk investment firm atomico , bloomberg reports .
lilium is trying to build the world 's first electric vertical take-off and landing ( vtol ) personal flight jet aircraft .
the prototype will carry five passengers and fly at a top speed of 300km per hour .
successful unmanned test flights were carried out on a two-seater prototype in april .

documents.title: read all about it
text: we know that newspapers are facing tough times , but they 're not quite dead yet .
tronc , the awfully named company that owns the chicago tribune and the los angeles times , has bought the new york daily news from media and property mogul mort zuckerman .
terms were not disclosed , but a source said tronc would assume liabilities of about $ 30m .
it also gets a half-share in a 25-acre piece of land in new jersey where the paper is printed , which might be the real prize .
mr zuckerman put the daily news - once america 's highest-selling paper - up for sale in february 2015 and wanted $ 200m for it at the time .
the news competes with the new york post , owned by rupert murdoch .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: norway 's vote of confidence
text: norway 's sovereign wealth fund - one of the world 's biggest - has shown confidence in the uk economy and the pound by raising its target for sterling bonds to 8 % of its main fund .
this is a very significant move .

it is extraordinary that they have opted for the uk as world number three for investment ahead of china and japan , '' said stephen jen , a currency expert at eurizonslj capital and an advisor to asian sovereign wealth funds told the telegraph .
norway 's $ 1 trillion ( £ 77bn ) government pension fund has also stepped up its expansion into london commercial property by buying a £ 112m stake in 20 air street in soho .

documents.title: lego to come 'smaller and less complex '
text: so why is lego slashing jobs ?
it appears that the toy maker 's attempts to diversify into other areas has affected its revenues .
in recent years lego has expanded to produce films , video games and theme parks .
`` in the process , we have added complexity into the organisation which now in turn makes it harder for us to grow further , '' chairman jorgen vig knudstorp said .
lego maker will become a `` smaller and less complex organisation '' to simplify its business model , with a focus on reaching more children .
`` we are very sorry to make changes which may interfere with the lives of many of our colleagues , '' mr knudstorp said .
`` unfortunately , it is essential for us to make these tough decisions . ''

documents.title: manufacturing 'will offset stagnant services '
text: paul hollingsworth , uk economist at capital economics , says the services pmis show the economy is `` struggling to up much pace '' in the third quarter .
however , he adds : `` we think that the manufacturing sector should put in a much stronger performance in q3 , after a punchy decline in q2 .
`` this should help to offset any slowdown in the consumer-facing services sectors in particular .
`` as a result , we continue to think that growth will come in a bit stronger in the second half of the year . ''

documents.title: fall in services sector growth 'unsurprising '
text: chris sood-nicholls , a managing director at lloyds bank commercial banking , said :
this drop in the index is unsurprising .
amid mixed economic signals , brexit brings an added layer of complexity and uncertainty , with many investment decisions going on-hold .
sterling weakness continues to drive price increases and consumers and businesses are feeling the pinch .
`` it 's difficult to see anything immediately on the horizon that will nudge the index out of its fairly flat performance . ''

documents.title: services growth falls in augustihs economist tweets
text: new research shows britain 's dominant services industry grew at its slowest pace in almost a year in august .
the ihs markit/cips services purchasing managers ' index fell to 53.2 in august from 53.8 in july .
anything below 50 marks stagnation .
the figures suggest britain 's economy is losing momentum as worries about brexit mount .
# pmi shows # uk # services activity slowed further in august to be at weakest level for 11 months ; index down to 53.2 ( 53.8 in jul

documents.title: august 'testing time ' for car industry
text: chris bosworth , director of strategy at close brothers motor finance , says august 's fall in new car sales was `` expected '' , as car buyers are waiting for new registration plates to come in .

`` august is a notoriously testing month for new car registrations as consumers divert their spending toward family activities and holidays , so these figures should n't come as a complete shock , '' he adds .
however , he said that brexit negotiations and government plans to curb emissions would create `` prolonged uncertainty '' for the industry .

documents.title: new car sales fall for fifth month
text: british new car registrations fell for the fifth month in a row in august , a car industry body has said .
sales fell 6.4 % to 76,433 vehicles , according to the society of motor manufacturers and traders ( smmt ) with demand for diesel cars slumping by more than 20 % .
the smmt expects full-year registrations to end the year down nearly 4 % at 2.59 million units from 2.69 million in 2016 .

documents.title: talktalk 'considering dumping mobile service '
text: talktalk is considering hiving off its mobile business , the financial times has reported .
quoting unnamed sources , it said the firm was in talks with rival operators vodafone , o2 and virgin media about a takeover .
the telecommunications company apparently wants to refocus on budget fixed-line broadband internet , which was its original business .
its mobile service , which runs off vodafone networks , has almost one million customers .
the telecommunications company originally intended to build its own mobile infrastructure , in addition to launching a virtual network on top of o2 's network .
however talktalk pulled out of the deal with o2 in 2016 , incurring a £ 49m impairment charge .

documents.title: lego to cut 8 % of its workforce
text: lego is cut some 8 % of its workforce after reporting a drop in first half sales .
the firm said it would cut approximately 1,400 positions , the majority of them before the end of 2017 .
it comes after the firm reported a 5 % fall in revenue to 14.9 billion danish crowns ( £ 1.8bn ) .
`` we are disappointed by the decline in revenue in our established markets , and we have taken steps to address this , '' chairman jorgen vig knudstorp said .
the company currently employs around 18,000 people worldwide .

documents.title: retailers lead ftse 100 higher
text: retailers are leading the london market higher on tuesday .
the best performer is next , up 2.2 % , followed by marks & spencer - 1.7 % higher .
the biggest fallers are consumer goods giant reckitt benckiser and doorstep lender provident financial .
both have shed around 1.2 % .
the ftse 100 is up by a modest 0.3 % at 7433.81 points .

documents.title: some '£ 184m stolen from businesses ' in three-year period
text: some £ 184m in commercial goods were stolen from uk businesses between 2013 and 2016 , according to research from self-storage provider space station .
it got the information by collating freedom of information ( foi ) requests from 20 constabularies across the country .
there are more than 40 police forces in england and wales .

the data reveals that greater manchester is britain 's business theft hotspot , with 147,887 cases recorded over a three-month period , followed by west yorkshire ( 110,053 thefts ) , derbyshire ( 96,369 thefts ) .
business theft refers to theft from shops and stalls , running away without paying , attempted theft or theft by an employee .

documents.title: aveva shares jump 25 %
text: shares in aveva have jumped by as much as 25 % after the british firm announced that it would merge with schneider electric .
the deal will create a company worth about £ 3bn , the firms said .

documents.title: angry birds owner flaps to €30m ipo
text: angry birds creator rovio has announced plans to raise at least €30m ( £ 27.6m ) by listing its shares .
the finnish mobile games and animation studio is on a high after reporting soaring revenues in the second quarter thanks to the angry birds movie .
`` we believe rovio is well positioned to succeed in the growing mobile gaming market and see a bright future ahead for the company , '' said rovio 's chairman mika ihamuotila .
`` the contemplated ipo and listing will offer new shareholders an opportunity to participate in rovio 's success . ''

documents.title: asia markets lower amid nk tensions
text: japan and south korea stock markets closed marginally lower on tuesday .
tokyo 's nikkei index fell 0.6 % , while seoul 's kospi slipped 0.1 % .
australia 's asx200 closed flat , down only slightly .
the losses follow investor fears that north korea could further provoke tensions on the korean peninsula .
the shanghai composite bucked the trend , closing up just over 0.1 % .

documents.title: 'most blantant abuse of pr '
text: `` this is the most blatant abuse of pr that i have ever seen , '' said franics ingham , the director-general of the prca , which is the trade body of the pr industry .

commenting on the expulsion of bell pottinger from the body he said : `` our members are furious about it because they do abide by those ethical standards and that 's why the prca have expelled bell pottinger and we 've taken the harshest action we 've ever taken against a member . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: ftse 100 opens flat
text: after falling yesterday on concerns about north korea 's nuclear capabilities , the ftse 100 is broadly flat in the opening minutes of trade on tuesday .
it 's up 0.1 % , or eight points , at 7,419.39 points .

documents.title: pr firms 'need integrity '
text: as we have been reporting , bell pottinger has been thrown out of the public relations and communications association ( prca ) after running a campaign in south africa that tried to stir up racial tensions .
borkowski pr founder mark borkowski said that the ruling has given the pr industry much to think about .
`` the world is changing , '' he told the today programme .
`` in the era of fake news , integrity should be at the heart of everything you do .
`` prs taking on these jobs need to question what they do that they have n't needed to do in the past . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 888 swings into loss
text: online bookmaker 888 has reported a pre-tax loss of $ 17.3m ( £ 13.4m ) for the six months to 30 june due to `` exceptional charges '' .
it follows a profit of $ 27.8m in the same period last year .

the charges include a record £ 7.8m fine from the uk gambling commission over a technical failure which meant 7,000 customers who had chosen to bar themselves from their 888 accounts were still able to gamble .
the group , which runs casino , poker , sports betting and bingo services , said revenue in the half rose 3 % to $ 270.1m from $ 262m last year .

documents.title: 'we hope help to buy will be extended ' - redrow chairman
text: demand for redrow 's homes has been strong due to an under-supply in the market and ow interest rates , says chairman steve morgan .
however , a huge boost to its sales - the government 's help to buy scheme - is scheduled to end in 2021 .
what will it do then ?
he told today : `` we hope it does n't go away , and and you have to remember that there has always been some form of assistance to help people purchase houses . ''
`` we are talking to the government about the extension of help to buy at the moment , '' he added .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: weakness of pound 'boosting uk exports '
text: british manufacturers say exports are going from strength to strength , according to a new survey by the manufacturers ' organisation eef .
output and orders have bounced back to historic highs in the third quarter - up 34 % and 37 % respectively .
`` there 's been a really positive run of response from manufactures from all sectors of the industry , '' eef 's chief economist lee hopley told the today programme .
`` it 's partly been down to the weakness of the pound .
`` back in 2009 , sterling 's plunge did n't have an impact on the state of manufacturing .
but the rest of the world is buying now , so the weakness of the pound is making exports particularly strong . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: halfords sales up due to 'staycations '
text: halfords has reported a 2.7 % increase in like-for-like revenue for the 20-week-period to 18 august 2017 , due to consumers choosing to have `` staycation '' summers , rather than go abroad .
the bike and car accessories retailer reported growth in sales of camping gear , roof boxes and cycle carriers .

documents.title: aveva and schneider electric agree software merger
text: british engineering software company aveva group has agreed to combine with schneider electric 's software business .
the move will create a london-listed software firm worth more than £ 3bn .
france 's schneider will take a 60 % stake in the combined group , which the firms say will be a `` global leader '' in engineering and industrial software .

documents.title: sales jump 20 % at housebuilder redrow
text: redrow has credited `` robust '' demand for new houses for a big jump in sales and profits .
in the 12 months to june , sales at the housebuilder rose by a fifth to £ 1.7bn , while pre-tax profits were up 26 % at £ 315m .
the firm noted that while overall housing transactions had reduced , demand in the new homes market remained strong .
`` we have not seen any impact from recent domestic and international political events , '' it added .

documents.title: in case you missed it
text: last night lord bell , the founder of bell pottinger , gave an interview to newsnight .
he had a reputation for taking on controversial clients , among them the chilean dictator augusto pincohet .
however , he had left the firm 18 months before its much criticised south africa campaign .

documents.title: bell pottinger 'should not have been thrown out '
text: bell pottinger should not have been thrown out of the industry 's trade body for its controversial campaign in south africa , says pr expert jason nisse .
`` i think they should have set them some ethical standards .
just chucking them out does n't actually do anything . ''
he added : `` you can argue that any client will look at them now and say , 'why should i be represented by them because they ca n't handle their own pr crisis ' . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: us firms agree aviation merger deal
text: industrial group united technologies corporation ( utc ) has agreed to buy airline parts maker rockwell for $ 23bn ( £ 17.8bn ) .
the merger is one of the biggest deals in aviation history and is expected to be completed next year .
it has the potential to shake up the market for aerospace parts and could give utc greater negotiating power over plane makers boeing and airbus .
both firms have been pushing suppliers , including utc , to lower their prices .

documents.title: underlying trends in retail 'remain the same '
text: as we have been reporting , british shoppers increased their spending in august at the fastest pace so far in 2017 , excluding a surge in april caused by the easter break .
that 's according to a survey of retailers by the british retail consortium .
but george godber , a fund manager at polar capital , says the underlying trends in the sector have not changed .
he told wake up to money : `` we 're seeing online sales rising and bricks-and-mortar retail suffering .
and the uk consumer is still facing a squeeze as wages are falling behind inflation . ''
another threat , he says , is that the bank of england is clamping down on unsecured credit .
that means consumers could struggle to fuel further spending with loans .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: is this the next financial scandal waiting to happen ?
text: a growing number of tech companies are raising funds by issuing their own digital currencies for investors to buy .
but the practice is completely unregulated .
is another financial scandal just around the corner ?
sean boulanger , a senior community manager at a cape town digital agency , does n't consider himself a serious investor .
but he came a company which was planning to raise money in a way he had never heard of before and decided to invest .
read the full story here .

documents.title: china gets tough on crypto-currencies
text: as we have reported , china 's central bank has banned individuals and firms from raising funds by offering their own digital currencies .
it follows a rise in the number of tech companies opting to sell digital `` tokens '' , akin to bitcoin , because they are quick , easy and unregulated .
here , asia business report presenter rico hizon gives his take :
china 's central bank has banned 'initial coin offerings ' and may soon tighten # cryptocurrency rules even further .
earlier on @ twitterid
they do n't want anything that gets around their control of the economy .

documents.title: the fight for craft beer in thailand
text: enterprising tao limjittrakorn is a man on a mission to bring craft beers to thailand .
however , it is not as easy as it sounds because he has to brew his beer over the border in cambodia .

documents.title: ombudsman gets 'around 4,000 ppi complaints a week '
text: there has been a 13 % rise in complaints handled by the financial ombudsman , with the biggest area being payment protection insurance ( ppi ) , accounting for around half .
the rise in ppi complaints is no surprise , because a government deadline to submit complaints is approaching , says chief executive caroline weyman .
`` that said , we are still getting about 4,000 cases every week so there are quite a lot more people out there , '' she told wake up to money .
she added that firms offering payday loans and car financing also attracted large numbers of complaints .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: retail sales rebound in august , says trade group
text: retail sales rebounded last month despite shoppers facing pressure from higher inflation , according to an industry report .
the british retail consortium , working with consultancy kpmg , said like-for-like sales rose 1.3 % in august , against a 0.9 % fall for the same month in 2016 .
sales of autumn fashion ranges and back-to-school kit were big contributors to the rise , it said .
but the body warned belt-tightening by consumers was still a risk .
read more

documents.title: good morning
text: good morning and welcome to business live .
coming up , we 'll have reaction to the news that bell pottinger has been thrown out of the pr industry trade body ( the prca ) over a campaign it ran in south africa .
critics said the campaign was `` divisive '' and stoked racial tensions .
a survey from trade body eef shows britain 's manufacturers are enjoying buoyant conditions on the back of a rise in exports .
and there will be corporate results from lego , halfords and housebuilder redrow .
